content: Is it possible to tell loogle to exclude something from search result? For example, I want to search something mentioning IntermediateField.adjoin and Membership.mem, but not Fintype. It is natural to input the search condition IntermediateField.adjoin, Membership.mem, -Fintype. But it doesn't recognize this pattern. Is there any way to do such search?
No, not yet. Itâ€™s certainly doable, I am basically trying to assess how often the need comes up, and whether itâ€™s worth it the additional complexity for users learning the query language.
I've run into this just now, I want to search for instances of using RingHomClass to construct data, so I wanted to type: RingHomClass, !âŠ¢ (_ : Prop)

now I was able to do it in a more complicated way:

  1. Search for RingHomClass and RingHomClass, âŠ¢ (_ : Prop)
  2. Compare the difference using the following:
  3. paste each result in https://regexr.com/ and list occurrences of .+ðŸ“‹
  4. paste each result into each side of https://www.diffchecker.com/text-compare/
  5. compare

In this case, would

RingHomClass, âŠ¢ (_ : Type _)

serve you well? (Granted, this may probably miss things that are in Sort u for arbitrary u. Not sure.)
